thread.title: H.S. boys soccer report: Around the pitch for Oct. 14 - Boys Soccer
thread.title_full: H.S. boys soccer report: Around the pitch for Oct. 14 - Boys Soccer - NorthJersey.com

author: The Record
title: H.S. boys soccer report: Around the pitch for Oct. 14 - Boys Soccer
text:
Around the pitch 
* The interchangeable use of juniors Ryan Miller and Michael Lin at forward and in the midfield has paid big dividends for coach Roy Nygren’s Pascack Valley (7-3) team. Lin has 11 goals and five assists, and Miller 13 goals and four assists.
Lin and Miller each had a goal and an assist when the eighth-seeded Indians defeated ninth-seeded Ramsey, 3-0, in a Bergen County tournament round-of-16 game. "They both started as sophomores last season and we move them around situationally. Both are having very solid years," Nygren said. 
* Cole Bosch, a junior forward, had a hat trick when top-seeded Bergen Catholic defeated 16th-seeded Park Ridge, 3-0, in the BCT. Bosch has nine goals and two assists for the Crusaders (8-0-2), the top team in The Record Top 25. 
* Jorge Salas tallied two goals when third-seeded Garfield turned back 14th-seeded Pascack Hills, 4-1, in the BCT. The junior forward has 13 goals and four assists. 
* Deydiry Chamba scored off an assist from Jean Lara to help Harrison edge North Bergen, 1-0, in a Hudson County tournament quarterfinal game. Christopher Crespo made nine saves for the shutout and Michael Mejia had 10 saves for North Bergen.
* Justin Fernandez had a goal and an assist and Joey Fedele had a goal to help River Dell past Paramus, 2-0, in a Big North interdivisional game. Luke Farrell made three saves to record the shutout.
* Christian Virgona scored off an assist from Lucas McGahren to push Northern Highlands past Pascack Hills, 1-0, in a Big North interdivisional game. Francesco D’Iorio’s assist on a goal by Nick Friedland powered the Highlanders past seventh-seeded Waldwick in the BCT. Jase Barrack had four saves for the 10th-seeded Highlanders. 
* Boonton defeated Parsippany, 1-0, in a Northwest Jersey Athletic Conference game behind a goal in the second half by Grant Barrientos off an assist from Bryan Ohlott. Tim Rittinger made eight saves for the shutout.
* Matt Apryasz had a goal and assist as Pequannock defeated Morristown-Beard, 3-1, in an NWJAC game. Sean Budowski and Matt Thomas scored the other goals for Pequannock and Bill Troast made 12 saves. 
* Rakip Veliu and Grant Barrientos each scored a goal and Tim Rittinger made seven saves as Boonton edged Kinnelon, 2-1, in overtime. 
* Freshman forward Axel Velazquez scored both goals to help Passaic Tech edge Passaic, 2-1, in a Big North Liberty Division game. George Hernandez (five) and Kevin Bueno (three) combined for eight saves for the Bulldogs. Anderson Aguilar had the lone goal for Passaic and Oscar Martinez had 11 saves. 
* Senior Wolfie Albrecht, returning after four weeks because of injury, scored a goal to help Indian Hills defeat Hackensack, 3-0, in a Big North Freedom Division game. John Murphy and Oliver Key had the other Braves goals, and Andrew Cameron made five saves.
* Jonathan Campos, Emre Erdogan and Christopher Garcia each had a goal to lift Bergen Charter to a 3-2 win over Ridgefield in an NJIC Liberty Division game. Junior goalie Juan Esquivel made 14 saves for the Yellow Jackets.
— Ed Mills
